inlineContent.text: Want to chat live with Stripe engineers? Join us on our

The Stripe iOS SDK makes it quick and easy to build an excellent payment experience in your iOS app. We provide powerful and customizable UI screens and elements that can be used out-of-the-box to collect your users‚Äô payment details. We also expose the low-level APIs that power those UIs so that you can build fully custom experiences.
Updating to a newer version of the SDK? See our
: We make it simple for you to collect sensitive data such as credit card numbers and remain
. This means the sensitive data is sent directly to Stripe instead of passing through your server. For more information, see our
: We provide native screens and elements to collect payment details. For example,
is a prebuilt UI that combines all the steps required to pay - collecting payment details, billing details, and confirming the payment - into a single sheet that displays on top of your app.
that correspond to objects and methods in the Stripe API. You can build your own entirely custom UI on top of this layer, while still taking advantage of utilities like
: We support card scanning on iOS 13 and higher. See our

: We support the following localizations: Bulgarian, Catalan, Chinese (Hong Kong), Chinese (Simplified), Chinese (Traditional), Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, English (US), English (United Kingdom), Estonian, Filipino, Finnish, French, French (Canada), German, Greek, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Latvian, Lithuanian, Malay, Maltese, Norwegian Bokm√•l, Norwegian Nynorsk (Norway), Polish, Portuguese, Portuguese (Brazil), Romanian, Russian, Slovak, Slovenian, Spanish, Spanish (Latin America), Swedish, Turkish, Thai and Vietnamese.
to verify the identity of your users.

If you‚Äôre selling digital products or services that will be consumed within your app, (e.g. subscriptions, in-game currencies, game levels, access to premium content, or unlocking a full version), you must use Apple‚Äôs in-app purchase APIs. See the
for more information. For all other scenarios you can use this SDK to process payments via Stripe.

The Stripe iOS SDK collects data to help us improve our products and prevent fraud. This data is never used for advertising and is not rented, sold, or given to advertisers. Our full privacy policy is available at
For help with Apple‚Äôs App Privacy Details form in App Store Connect, visit
Connect embedded components to add connected account dashboard functionality to your app.
Securely capture ID documents and selfies on iOS for use with
to confirm the identity of global users.
Securely connect financial accounts to Stripe‚Äôs merchant account with
Contains all the below frameworks, plus
Bindings for the Stripe Payments API.
Bindings for the Stripe Payments API,
We support Cocoapods and Swift Package Manager.
If you link the library manually, use a version from our
page and make sure to embed
For other modules, follow the instructions below:
If you‚Äôre reading this on GitHub.com, please make sure you are looking at the
that corresponds to the release you have installed. Otherwise, the instructions and example code may be mismatched with your copy.
The Stripe iOS SDK requires Xcode 15 or later and is compatible with apps targeting iOS 13 or above. We support Catalyst on macOS 11 or later.
. If you need to support iOS 9, use
for fine-grained documentation of all the classes and methods in the SDK.
This example demonstrates how to build a payment flow using
, an embeddable native UI component that lets you accept
This example demonstrates how to manually accept various payment methods using the Stripe API.
offers built-in card scanning. To enable card scanning, you‚Äôll need to set
in your application‚Äôs plist, and provide a reason for accessing the camera (e.g. ‚ÄúTo scan cards‚Äù). Card scanning is supported on devices with iOS 13 or higher.
You can demo this feature in our
. When you run the example app on a device, you‚Äôll see a ‚ÄúScan Card‚Äù button when adding a new card.

We welcome contributions of any kind including new features, bug fixes, and documentation improvements. Please first open an issue describing what you want to build if it is a major change so that we can discuss how to move forward. Otherwise, go ahead and open a pull request for minor changes such as typo fixes and one liners.
From the root of the repo, run

inlineContent.code: bundle install && bundle exec fastlane stripeios_tests

inlineContent.text: . This will install the test dependencies and run the tests.
Once you have run this once, you can also run the tests in Xcode from the
To re-record snapshot tests, use the
To lint your code before pushing you can run
You can also add this script as a pre-push hook by running
To format modified files automatically, you can use
and you can add it as a pre-commit hook using

STPPaymentCardTextField is a text field with similar properties to UITextField,
but specialized for credit/debit card information. It manages
multiple UITextFields under the hood to collect this information. It‚Äôs
designed to fit on a single line, and from a design perspective can be used
anywhere a UITextField would be appropriate.
This class is a piece of fake UI that is intended to mimic
. That class is restricted to apps with a special entitlement from Apple, and as such can be difficult to build and test against. This class implements the same public API as
, and can be used to develop against the Stripe API in
. (Obviously it will not actually place cards into the user‚Äôs Apple Pay wallet either.) When it‚Äôs time to go to production, you may simply replace all references to
in your app with
and it will continue to function. For more information on developing against this API, please see https://stripe.com/docs/issuing/cards/digital-wallets .

This class makes it easier to implement ‚ÄúPush Provisioning‚Äù, the process by which an end-user can add a card to their Apple Pay wallet without having to type their number. This process is mediated by an Apple class called

; this class will help you implement that class‚Äô delegate methods. Note that this flow requires a special entitlement from Apple; for more information please see https://stripe.com/docs/issuing/cards/digital-wallets .
